messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fw: possible unschooling resocue
messages.msgSnippet: Well then, I m glad I send him a reply saying congratulations and good luck.  He caught me on a good day!  I thought it was spam! the Other Amy! I got it too,
messages.messageBody:
Well then, I'm glad I send him a reply saying congratulations and good luck.  He caught me on a good day!  I thought it was spam!
 
the Other Amy!
 
I got it too, actually about a week ago or so. Jonathan is a member of this list, but does not post. i responded to his original post and he was very happy to get feedback.
 
Amy
Mom to Samantha, Dana, and Casey
The World Is Our Classroom

messages.msgSnippet: yes, I received it also. Bonnie ... _________________________________________________________________________ Get Your Private, Free E-mail from MSN Hotmail at
messages.messageBody:
yes, I received it also.

Bonnie


>From: "Colette and Andrew" <woofermom@...>
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
>To: "Unschooling List" <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fw: possible unschooling resocue
>Date: Tue, 12 Sep 2000 18:41:14 -0700
>
>Hello~
>
> I recieved this today and was wondering if anyone else on this list
>recieved this also?
>
>Thanks!
>Colette
>----- Original Message -----
>From: Jonathan Mooney <jonathanmooney@...>
>To: <woofermom@...>
>Sent: Tuesday, September 12, 2000 4:58 PM
>Subject: possible unschooling resocue
>
>
> > Hey there,
> >
> > sorry for the out of the blue email-but I am member of unschooling list
> > service and wanted to share with you a very cool thing in my life (I
> > haven't had the opportunity to post as often as I would of liked. I am
> > dyslexic and writing short little off the cuff post is hard for me. My
> > mind tends to get overwhelmed with ideas that are much quicker then my
>pen,
> > so I often just sit on the side lines and enjoy the great flow of great
> > ideas!).
> >
> > But today my book Learning Outside the Lines (Simon & Schuster) is
> > officially published!!! This day has special meaning to me, considering
> > that I did not learn to read until I was 12, drooped out of sixth grade
>and
> > was home schooled, only to be told the rest of my life that I would be a
> > failure. I am happy to say that the infamous "they" (we all know them )
> > were wrong about me-not only is my book out, but I recently graduated
>brown
> > university with honors in English literature.
> >
> > The book itself is my small attempt to make sure other students don't go
> > through the shame and struggle that I did, whether they are LD/ADHD,
>home
> > schooled, or simply think different. The book explores my and my
>co-authors
> > (an ADHD, high school drop out who also graduated from brown) journey
> > through school then out lines alternative learning skills we developed
>to
> > beat all the odds.
> >
> > My royalties for Learning outside the lines also go to my other attempt
>to
> > help kids who think different, Project eye to eye-a national acclaimed
> > mentoring program for LD/ADHD children.
> >
> > The book is out all over the place now (a scary things for a kid who
>could
> > never even read teachers comments on his papers) and I would love to
>hear
> > what you think. The easiest place to check it out on line is at this
>link:
> >
> >
>http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/068486598X/qid%3D968205875/104-747208
> > 6-8330358
> >
> > But most importantly I wanted to thank you for your commitment to
> > alternative learning and cognitive diversity. Thanks so much for letting
>me
> > be a part of it.
> >
> > cheers
> >
> > jm
> >
> >
> >
>

_________________________________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fw: possible unschooling resocue
messages.msgSnippet: I just wondered about it........ the book does sound really good tho!  I ll be looking into it for sure!  :o)  Jonathan is certainly someone to admire and if
messages.messageBody:
I just wondered about it........ the book does sound really good tho!  I'll be looking into it for sure!  :o)  Jonathan is certainly someone to admire and if anything, I would like to get the book for my son.
 
Thanks to everyone for responding to my query!
Colette
 
 
 
I got it too, actually about a week ago or so. Jonathan is a member of this list, but does not post. i responded to his original post and he was very happy to get feedback.
 
Amy
Mom to Samantha, Dana, and Casey
The World Is Our Classroom

Have a great week everyone!
Colette

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fw: possible unschooling resocue
messages.msgSnippet: ... I got it too.... and I have a preview copy of his book on my desk. It s a great story and he sounds eerily like a homeschooler in his view of public
messages.messageBody:
>---------------------------------------------------------------------_->
>
>Colette,
>
>I got it too.
>
>
I got it too.... and I have a preview copy of his book on my desk. It's a
great story and he sounds eerily like a homeschooler in his view of public
schooling. My favorite quote is this, "educational revolution is the
ultimate outcome of pursuing an education that is about personal
empowerment." His choice of words to describe life as an LD classroom child
is stark and sometimes harsh. The last section of tips, tricks and tools on
succeeding in college is very good, no matter what the LD. If my children
will coooperate I'll write a real review this week. <G>

I suspect we should tell him that harvesting names off of email lists is not
completely kosher. :)

LisaKK

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fw: possible unschooling resocue

messages.messageBody:
Thank-you Billy for answering! :o)  Makes me just abit nervous to recieve e-mail from someone I don't know even with a great subject such as unschooling/home-schooling!
 
Have a great week everyone!
Colette
 
 

Colette,

I got it too.

Billy

messages.subject: Fw: possible unschooling resocue
messages.msgSnippet: Hello~ I recieved this today and was wondering if anyone else on this list recieved this also? Thanks! Colette ... From: Jonathan Mooney
messages.messageBody:
Hello~

I recieved this today and was wondering if anyone else on this list
recieved this also?

Thanks!
Colette
----- Original Message -----
From: Jonathan Mooney <jonathanmooney@...>
To: <woofermom@...>
Sent: Tuesday, September 12, 2000 4:58 PM
Subject: possible unschooling resocue


> Hey there,
>
> sorry for the out of the blue email-but I am member of unschooling list
> service and wanted to share with you a very cool thing in my life (I
> haven't had the opportunity to post as often as I would of liked. I am
> dyslexic and writing short little off the cuff post is hard for me. My
> mind tends to get overwhelmed with ideas that are much quicker then my
pen,
> so I often just sit on the side lines and enjoy the great flow of great
> ideas!).
>
> But today my book Learning Outside the Lines (Simon & Schuster) is
> officially published!!! This day has special meaning to me, considering
> that I did not learn to read until I was 12, drooped out of sixth grade
and
> was home schooled, only to be told the rest of my life that I would be a
> failure. I am happy to say that the infamous "they" (we all know them )
> were wrong about me-not only is my book out, but I recently graduated
brown
> university with honors in English literature.
>
> The book itself is my small attempt to make sure other students don't go
> through the shame and struggle that I did, whether they are LD/ADHD, home
> schooled, or simply think different. The book explores my and my
co-authors
> (an ADHD, high school drop out who also graduated from brown) journey
> through school then out lines alternative learning skills we developed to
> beat all the odds.
>
> My royalties for Learning outside the lines also go to my other attempt to
> help kids who think different, Project eye to eye-a national acclaimed
> mentoring program for LD/ADHD children.
>
> The book is out all over the place now (a scary things for a kid who could
> never even read teachers comments on his papers) and I would love to hear
> what you think. The easiest place to check it out on line is at this
link:
>
>
http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/068486598X/qid%3D968205875/104-747208
> 6-8330358
>
> But most importantly I wanted to thank you for your commitment to
> alternative learning and cognitive diversity. Thanks so much for letting
me
> be a part of it.
>
> cheers
>
> jm
>
>
>
